body: LEAD: The sight of unsupervised students clustering in the hallways of a high school throughout the day usually means that things are not being run properly, that orderliness has given way to entropy. title: A High School Finds Success in Freedom

body: LEAD: From the ashes of six sacred Torah scrolls, torched in a Brooklyn synagogue two months ago, grew a gentle gesture that brought the memory of a dead policeman, a burglary, a mystery and a police commissioner with a private debt together in another synagogue yesterday. title: Sacred Gift Solves a Mystery, Repays a Debt

title: Special High Schools: Prized Goal for Students

body: LEAD: A 15-year-old boy who was arrested in the arson of a Brooklyn synagogue in which five Torah scrolls were destroyed has been indicted by a grand jury and will be tried as an adult in State Supreme Court, instead of Family Court where the possible punishment is less severe. title: 15-Year-Old Boy Is Indicted As Adult in Synagogue Fire

body: LEAD: Lafayette, a school that won only twice last season, has become one of the powers in the Brooklyn A Division of the Public Schools Athletic League this season. title: SCHOOL SPORTS; Lafayette Gains 3d Victory in a Row P.S.A.L.

body: LEAD: The crowd cried ''Huzzah!'' as a pair of horsemen galloped up to a post, trying to spear cantaloupes and cranshaw melons balanced on it. Public officials wore long robes and funny hats. Their constituents strolled about, gnawing on turkey legs and drinking from cattle horns dangling on strings around their necks. The crowd cried ''Huzzah!''
title: Jousting With Melons: A Frolic for Medievalists
